intro: Hieracium niveotomentosum, commonly known as the snow-haired hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features finely hairy, grayish-green leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of white or silver hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. Hieracium niveotomentosum thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats.
